image.altText: A man in a white shirt and pink hat sits in a helicopter cockpit

props.synopsis: After surviving a serious helicopter crash, this multi-skilled butcher becomes the face of a paddock-to-plate business in rural Australia.

title.children: The flying butcher brings local beef back to Katherine after 25 years

image.altText: A woman in a brown dress looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Darwin midwife Claire Marks, who has been placed under a number of conditions by Australia's medical regulator, will continue to run the Northern Territory government's new private practice midwifery service, it's been confirmed.

title.children: Midwife banned from working unsupervised handed $1.1m NT government contract

image.altText: A woman with her hair up in a pink suit looks directly at the camera.

props.synopsis: A growing number of women in the Northern Territory are travelling interstate to give birth — or leaving the territory altogether — following the sudden closure of the only private hospital maternity ward. Now, the NT's last private obstetrician is closing her practice.

title.children: NT's last private obstetrician walks as maternity services face collapse

image.altText: Chief Minister Lia Finocchiaro and David Connolly standing in cattle yards

props.synopsis: A history of questionable social media posts from the NT's next administrator David Connolly have emerged, but the chief minister say she stands by her nomination of him.

title.children: Questionable social media posts by next NT administrator emerge

image.altText: Green shrubbery in the foreground, with an NT police vehicle in the distance included a police wagon.

props.synopsis: NT police say they have recovered the body of a missing 44-year-old man, following a large-scale search-and-rescue operation in a Darwin reserve.

title.children: Missing man's body found at Darwin's East Point after large-scale search

image.altText: Standing atop a pillar, men cheer as a statue of a horse tumbles down its side

props.synopsis: Protesters are urging US President Donald Trump to help dismantle Iran's theocracy. If he answers the call, it won't be the first time the US has toppled an Iranian government.

title.children: The CIA orchestrated an Iranian coup seven decades ago. It still haunts the US

image.altText: An Italian tennis player serves during an Australian Open match.

props.synopsis: Luckless Italian star Matteo Berrettini withdraws from his first-round Australian Open clash with Alex de Minaur, as day one of the first tennis grand slam of 2026 kicks off with Carlos Alcaraz and Aryna Sabalenka the main attractions. Follow live.

title.children: De Minaur gets lucky break as Australian Open gets underway

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Day groundpasses already sold out for day one
Huge rankings leap for Aussie women
Aussie wildcard among first Australian Open matches

image.altText: A red BHP logo on a glass building in front of a grey sky

props.synopsis: The year is barely underway but already there's a power struggle between our biggest corporations as they fight it out for line honours.

title.children: BHP popular with investors as CBA loses its shine in market

image.altText: a big white ship with "global mercy" written on it's bow

props.synopsis: On the largest civilian hospital ship in the world, Australian volunteers provide life-changing healthcare that is transforming lives.

title.children: On the world's largest hospital ship volunteers give people a chance at a better life

image.altText: Four people in yellow fire jackets stand in a row (two men, a woman and another man).

props.synopsis: The volunteer brigade from Terip Terip went through "hell" and back, narrowly escaping death while fighting to save their own community and those nearby.

title.children: As a bushfire raged around them, a volunteer brigade made a plan to survive

image.altText: A man taking a selfie with his wife and four daughters near a beach

props.synopsis: Experts on the benefit of charging board and expenses if you’re sharing a home with young adults, and how to calculate it.

title.children: How to calculate board or rent if you have adult children at home

image.altText: A man catching a wave on a white surfboard

props.synopsis: Former professional surfers and board makers have chosen this small coastal paradise as their home, but with smaller waves, what makes it so special?

title.children: Tourists triple the population of this coastal town, and some never leave

image.altText: A large shark with grey top half and white bottom half near the ocean surface being hit by sun beams.

props.synopsis: Several shark species are on the move as waters warm along Australia’s east coast. Here's how climate change is affecting the range of three major species.

title.children: Sharks seek sea change as ocean temperatures rise

image.altText: a woman eats food with chopsticks in a cafeteria

props.synopsis: Camps offering intensive weight loss programs are on the rise in China as the country faces skyrocketing obesity rates.

title.children: Australian woman attends 'prison' amid Chinese weight loss craze

image.altText: A woman with short cropped hair sits at an easel painting an outback landscape

props.synopsis: Jenny and Steve Greentree's young family faced losing everything in the millennium drought. Twenty years on, their thriving art gallery has helped to put Bourke on the map.

title.children: Artist's paintings sprouted from dry red dust of Bourke's harshest years

image.altText: A gold statue of a blindfolded woman holding a set of scales.

props.synopsis: A Victorian Supreme Court trial is forging ahead with amended transcripts after an interpreter made more than 200 translation errors during a key witness' evidence.

title.children: Interpreter makes more than 200 errors in Supreme Court trial

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Wow, you really don't quit. Let's see how poorly you perform this week.

title.children: New year, new you? Ha. Let’s play… HARD!

image.altText: Sam Kerr smiles as she runs off in celebration of a goal for Chelsea

props.synopsis: Sam Kerr declares she is approaching her best form after scoring twice for Chelsea in a Women's FA Cup victory over Crystal Palace.

title.children: 'Back to my best': Kerr's comeback continues with FA Cup double

image.altText: Scotty James holds his snowboard and trophy in the air while standing on top of a podium

props.synopsis: Sledder Bree Walker finishes second in the overall monobob standings after winning silver in Altenberg, while Scotty James tuned up for Milan-Cortina with victory in Switzerland.

title.children: James triumphs as Aussie barely misses bobsled history in Milan-Cortina build-up

image.altText: Cyclists ride alongside a beach during a road race

props.synopsis: The Australian Liv AlUla Jayco team is out to rescue its women's Tour Down Under campaign after a painful start in Saturday's opening stage.

title.children: Crashes thwart Australian team on day one of women's Tour Down Under

image.altText: Novak Djokovic kisses the Australian Open trophy

props.synopsis: After two years stuck one shy of the all-time grand slam titles record, Novak Djokovic believes the Australian Open is as good a place as any to make his greatest piece of history.

title.children: Why Djokovic won't be burdened by grand slam record chase

image.altText: People marching through the streets of Copenhagen under slogans 'Hands off Greenland'.

props.synopsis: Chanting "Greenland is not for sale" and carrying banners saying "Hands off Greenland", thousands of people have marched in Denmark, responding to US President Donald Trump's ambitions to acquire the Arctic island.

title.children: Greenland is not for sale: Thousands take to the streets of Denmark

image.altText: A toy giraffe in a children's truck lies sideways on a floor, next to a yo-yo with a smiling face.

props.synopsis: Staffing and supervision gaps at Canberra childcare centres have resulted in children sustaining broken bones and dislocated jaws, regulator files have revealed, prompting the ACT government to promise change.

title.children: Broken bones, ignored warnings: Inside Canberra's childcare staffing failures

image.altText: a woman carries an aboriginal flag duirng an invasion day rally in 2024

props.synopsis: Lawyers, human rights advocates and civil libertarians are urging the NSW Police Commissioner not to extend a ban on authorised public assemblies as January 26 approaches.

title.children: Calls for NSW police to end protest restrictions before Australia Day rallies

image.altText: Tim Walz is surrounded by  people at a public event in the US

props.synopsis: Minnesota Governor Tim Walz says the federal justice system is being weaponised to intimidate Donald Trump's perceived political enemies.

title.children: US Justice Department opens criminal investigation into Minnesota officials

image.altText: Flight tracker path PK-THT

props.synopsis: Search and rescue crews have been deployed to the mountainous area of Maros Regency to look for the plane.

title.children: Indonesian fisheries plane goes missing with 11 on board

image.altText: Koala sitting in a tree

props.synopsis: South Australia's Mount Lofty Ranges is experiencing a koala population boom that would likely lead to starvation and deaths, researchers say.

title.children: Adelaide Hills koala population boom risks starvation, study finds

image.altText: A black and white image of a boat on the water

props.synopsis: Fed up with restrictions over what they earned and where they could go, pearl boat workers embarked on nine months of industrial action that would change the face of their communities forever. Ninety years on, their legacy is still felt across the Torres Strait.

title.children: How trailblazing strikers jumped out of windows to oppose government control

image.altText: A glass ball is illuminated by golden sunlight.

props.synopsis: Geraldton's Horizon Ball sculpture is drawing huge crowds of tourists after the spot gained international attention on social media.

title.children: Crowds flock to beach sculpture to see the sun set upside down

image.altText: Ayatollah Ali Khamenei speaking at a microphone.

props.synopsis: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ali Khamenei, has labelled Donald Trump a criminal, blaming him for the deaths of thousands of demonstrators and security forces.

title.children: Iran's leader Khamenei calls Trump a 'criminal' for backing protests

image.altText: John fenlon centre of a picture on holiday at the beach in roratonga.

props.synopsis: From February 25, dual citizens of the UK and Ireland will be required to enter the UK using a valid British or Irish passport, a change causing major headaches for dual citizens with imminent travel plans.

title.children: Passport rule change disrupts travel plans for thousands of Aussies

image.altText: A close up of a man half smiling wearing a dark blue cap

props.synopsis: Australian cricket great Damien Martyn has paid tribute to the support he has received during his remarkable recovery from meningitis, while revealing he was given a "50:50 chance" of surviving the illness.

title.children: 'I'm back!' Damien Martyn shares heartfelt update on remarkable recovery

image.altText: A SailGP boat featuring Bonds logos racing on water.

props.synopsis: SailGP debutant Sweden is locked in a three-way tie for the lead after the first day of racing in Fremantle, with the Australian boat Flying Roos well placed in fourth spot heading into Sunday's races.

title.children: Debutants impress, Australia well placed after SailGP Fremantle day one

image.altText: A teenager in a beige hoody and jeans pats down dirt bike jumps with the back of a large shovel in the bush.

props.synopsis: Authorities destroying bike jumps built illegally by kids is not a new thing, but research indicates that those authorities should instead seek to work with young people, like Zeke Woolcock, on building trails.

title.children: Work with kids, instead of destroying their bike jumps, authorities told
